title: Eurotrip 2004
name: Eurotrip 2004
description:
A Map by Queenkv

Fall 2004 - My honey and I lived in Europe for three months. I worked at Reuters in London and he telecommuted back to his Berkeley job. We had a blast bopping around Europe. We want to go back someday.

properties.name: House of Parliament
properties.description: Posted by Queenkv We liked walking by this area. I liked taking pictures of my bear by the House of Lords and Commons. Such a noble city.

properties.name: Johin Sushi
properties.description: Posted by Queenkv London, WC1X 8AJMy favorite lunch spot when I worked at Reuters in London. It\'s a small deli with a row of stools for dining in. Most folks ordered out for take-away at lunchtime. As for myself, I loved eating there and working on postcards. I\'m grateful folks at Johin would let me special order items that are not part of their lunch specials: coconut soup and rice. The soup was so rich and the rice sopped it up nicely. At times, I would add some sushi to my lunch orders. But most of the time, I would get full on the soup and rice. When I couldn\'t finish lunch, I would heated up the soup and rice separately at home. For breakfast, I would then dump both into one bowl. It\'s a tasty breakfast for a gal like me who doesn\'t have much of a sweet tooth in the morning.

properties.name: La Terrasse
properties.description: Posted by Queenkv 2, pl Ecole Militaire, 75007 Paris, FranceThe first dinner for global journalism students was at La Terrasse on Sunday night. It\'s just off the Ecole Militaire Metro stop....and a few blocks from the Effiel Tour.

properties.name: Leicester Square - the center of entertainment...
properties.description: Posted by QueenkvLeicester Square, london, ukEverything seemed to be going on in Leicester Square. (pronounced: "Lester"). We bought theater tickets here, watching I-Robot....and I got up-close-and-personal with Jude Law and Pierce Brosnan during their movie premieres. I loved the Xmas carnival that rolled in...on our last night, we took a swing through the carnival rides.

properties.name: Mass at Notre Dame
properties.description: Posted by Queenkvparis We went to mass at Notre Dame. It was a beautiful experience.

properties.name: Medill's Paris Seminar: Fall 2004
properties.description: Posted by Queenkvparis, franceI took off to France for my next adventure in grad school. I took a global journalism seminar in the heart of Paris, France. Those two weeks were amazing - talking to journalists from all over the world and exploring all the different Paris neighborhoods. Mark rented a flat inside the 3rd Arron. It was romantic and in the center of everything...plus it had internet access :) And after two weeks, I headed to London for my residency at Reuters.

properties.name: My tube stop on the way to Reuters
properties.description: Posted by Queenkvoxford circus, london, ukDuring my Reuters residency, I lived about 5-minute walk from this tube stop. I\'d try to fit in some blogging and e-mail a few hours before I had to take off. Sometimes I had coffee with me on the tube. Sometimes I was pissed at work. But I\'m grateful for the experience of working at international wire service in Europe. I miss London.

properties.name: Our Home in Paris
properties.description: Posted by Queenkvrue bernard de clairvaux paris franceWe stayed in a lovely studio in the 3 arrondissment - right in this square called: "Passage de l\'Horloge". It had DSL and that was a blessing for us. It was so close to cafes, bars, museums, metro. I\'d love to stay here again or nearby...on our next trip to Paris.

properties.name: Piccadilly Circus
properties.description: Posted by Queenkv Picadilly, London, UKOur flat was a five minute walk away from Picadilly Circus....My dad reminded me we visited this touristy part of town, more than ten years ago...It looks different...I didn\'t remember seeing Virgn Record Stores, Burger King, Starbucks, McDonald\'s and Pizza Hut around the Eros statue. I know it\'s a tourist-trap, but there\'s a special place in my heart for Piccadilly - it was my alternate Tube stop for work. Sometimes Mark telecommuted from the Burger King nearby and I would meet up with him after work. Plus, Piccadilly is the easiest place to navigate to. Often I\'d meet up with Andrea and friends at this spot.

properties.name: Prague Castle
properties.description: Posted by QueenkvpragueI loved Prague. Sara did her residency in Prague, so we had a free place to crash and explore this beautiful city. It was most dramatic castle we visited in Europe. We also had our first snowfall in Europe - here...Nov. 2004.

properties.name: Prime Meridian
properties.description: Posted by Queenkvgreenwich, ukI had one foot in the eastern hemisphere and one foot in the western hemisphere. And it felt damn cool!

properties.name: Refuge des Fondues
properties.description: Posted by Queenkv17 Rue des Trois Frères paris franceFondue in Paris...our global journalism crew ate here on our last night together in Paris. We got vin blanche and vin rouge served in baby bottles. Funny and comforting.... And when it comes to fondue...You have focus on twirling just the right amount of formage on to your bread piece. You also have to make sure your meat is as cooked as you want it to be...

properties.name: Saint Patrick's Cathedral
properties.description: Posted by Queenkvdublin, ireland

properties.name: Swords Castle
properties.description: Posted by QueenkvSwords, IrelandOn our trip to Ireland, we stayed at a motel outside of Swords. As everyone took a bus into Dublin, Mark and I explored Swords...Mark had a meeting and we had to stay near by. Swords was small, quaint and it had a castle under renovations. Plus it had an e-mail cafe.

properties.name: Vatican City, Italy
properties.description: Posted by Queenkvvatican city, italyI had one foot in Rome and one foot in the Vatican City....crossing the border...baby! On another note...visiting the Vatican and going to mass inside St. Peter\'s Basilica - was an amazing spiritual experience. even though mass was conducted in Italian - I could still follow the rituals by heart.
